adjective.description: Designating the uppermost stage of the Lower Cretaceous (especially in Europe), above the Aptian and below the Cenomanian; of or relating to this stage.

noun.description: The Albian stage of the Cretaceous; the strata dating from this stage.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Quarterly Journal of the Geological Society of London. From Alba, former name of a department of France (now Aube) + -ian, after French Albien.
